extends java.lang.Object

public class that represents the requirements of a DevelopmentCard

  • Method Details

    • checkReq

      public boolean checkReq​(Board board) throws InvalidActionException, ResourcesExpectedException
      Description copied from interface: Requirements
      This method checks if the requirements of the card are met, otherwise an InvalidActionException is thrown.
      Specified by:
      checkReq in interface Requirements
      Parameters:
      board - is the board on which we are checking the requisites
      Returns:
      true if the player's board meets the requirements of the card
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException - if the requirements of the card are not satisfied by the player's board
      ResourcesExpectedException - if the card need more information to check the requirements. In this case, ResourceReqDev will throw this exception because it needs the current state of the player's StrongBox and Warehouse

    • checkReq

      public boolean checkReq​(Board board, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> shelves, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> quantity, java.util.ArrayList<ResQuantity> strongbox) throws InvalidActionException
      This method checks if the resources selected from the warehouse and from the strongBox meet the purchase requirements.
      Specified by:
      checkReq in interface Requirements
      Parameters:
      board - represents the board associated to a player
      shelves - ArrayList of Integer which represents all the shelves selected
      quantity - ArrayList of Integer which represents the amount of resources selected for each shelf
      strongbox - ArrayList of ResQuantity which represents all the resources selected from the strongBox It is important that each resource is present at most once
      Returns:
      true if the check is successful
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException - if the resources selected are not enough or if they are too many

    • getRequirements

      public java.util.HashMap<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> getRequirements()
      Specified by:
      getRequirements in interface Requirements
      Returns:
      HasMap(Resource,Integer) with all the resources present in the requirements

    • getCardRequirements

      public java.util.LinkedList<CardQuantity> getCardRequirements()
      Specified by:
      getCardRequirements in interface Requirements
      Returns:
      LinkedList of CardQuantity with all the cards present in the requirements
